title: usdatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
text: usdatasets package provides comprehensive collection U.S. datasets, encompassing various fields crime, economics, education, finance, energy, healthcare, . package serves valuable resource researchers analysts seeking perform -depth analyses derive insights U.S.-specific data.

title: usdatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
text: facilitate identification data types, suffix added end name dataset. suffixes indicate format type datasets, : tbl_df: tibble data frame df: standard data frame ts: time series object matrix: matrix object character: character vector numeric: numeric vector factor: factor variable

title: usdatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
text: examples datasets included usdatasets package: marathon_tbl_df: tibble containing marathon race data, including runner statistics performance metrics. mn_police_use_of_force_df: data frame documenting incidents police use force Minnesota. nba_players_19_tbl_df: tibble includes data NBA players 2019 season. ncbirths_tbl_df: tibble summarizing birth statistics across various demographics. nyc_marathon_tbl_df: tibble containing results statistics New York City Marathon. nycvehiclethefts_tbl_df: data frame documenting vehicle theft incidents New York City.

title: usdatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
text: illustrate data, can use ggplot2 package create visualizations. examples:

title: usdatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
code: # Example: Visualizing finish times of the NYC Marathon # Ajustado para las columnas disponibles en 'marathon_tbl_df' marathon_tbl_df %>%   ggplot(aes(x = year, y = time, color = gender)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.6) +   labs(title = "Marathon Finish Times by Year and Gender",        x = "Year",        y = "Finish Time (minutes)",        color = "Gender") +   theme_minimal()

title: usdatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
code: # Example: Visualizing the distribution of NBA player heights nba_players_19_tbl_df %>%   ggplot(aes(x = height)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 2, alpha = 0.7, fill = "blue", color = "black") +   labs(title = "Distribution of NBA Player Heights",        x = "Height (inches)",        y = "Count") +   theme_minimal()

what: 3. Visualization of Police Use of Force Incidents
title: usdatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
code: # Example: Visualizing police use of force incidents by race mn_police_use_of_force_df %>%   group_by(race) %>%   summarize(count = n()) %>%   ggplot(aes(x = reorder(race, count), y = count, fill = race)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   labs(title = "Incidents of Police Use of Force by Race",        x = "Race",        y = "Number of Incidents") +   theme_minimal() +   coord_flip()

title: usdatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
text: usdatasets package invaluable tool looking analyze derive insights variety U.S.-specific datasets. suffixes used dataset names help users quickly identify type data working , facilitating smoother analysis process. information explore datasets, please refer package documentation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Renzo Caceres Rossi. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Rossi RC (2024). usdatasets: Comprehensive Collection U.S. Datasets. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/lightbluetitan/usdatasets.
code: @Manual{,   title = {usdatasets: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets},   author = {Renzo Caceres Rossi},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/lightbluetitan/usdatasets}, }

what: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
title: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
text: usdatasets package provides diverse collection U.S.-exclusive datasets, encompassing various fields crime, economics, education, finance, energy, healthcare, . package serves valuable resource researchers analysts seeking perform -depth analyses derive insights U.S.-specific data. dataset usdatasets package named suffix end, indicating type class dataset, making easier identify work different data structures.

title: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
text: can install usdatasets package CRAN following command:

title: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
text: package installed, can load datasets begin analyzing U.S.-specific data. dataset follows consistent naming convention suffix indicates data structure (e.g., _ts time series, _df data frames, etc.).
code: # Load the package library(usdatasets)  # Load a dataset data("USAccDeaths_ts")  # View the dataset head(USAccDeaths_ts)  # Load another dataset data("USJudgeRatings_df")  # View the dataset head(USJudgeRatings_df)

title: A Comprehensive Collection of U.S. Datasets
text: example datasets provided usdatasets package, illustrating U.S.-specific focus naming convention dataset structures: UCBAdmissions_table: Student Admissions UC Berkeley. USAccDeaths_ts: Accidental Deaths U.S. 1973 1978 (_ts time series). USJudgeRatings_df: Lawyers’ Ratings State Judges U.S. Superior Court (_df data frame). UScitiesD_dist: Distances U.S. Cities (_dist distance matrices). state_area_num: U.S. State Area Facts (_num numeric data).`

American Community Survey 2012 — acs12_tbl_df
text: tibble 2,000 observations 13 variables: income Income individuals (integer). employment Employment status (factor 3 levels). hrs_work Number hours worked per week (integer). race Race individuals (factor 4 levels). age Age individuals (integer). gender Gender individuals (factor 2 levels: "male", "female"). citizen Citizenship status (factor 2 levels: "", "yes"). time_to_work Time taken travel work minutes (integer). lang Primary language spoken home (factor 2 levels: "english", ""). married Marital status (factor 2 levels: "", "yes"). edu Educational attainment (factor 3 levels). disability Disability status (factor 2 levels). birth_qrtr Birth quarter individuals (factor 4 levels).

title: American Community Survey 2012 — acs12_tbl_df
text: American Community Survey, 2012.

title: Housing prices in Ames, Iowa — ames_tbl_df
Housing prices in Ames, Iowa — ames_tbl_df
text: tibble 2,930 observations 82 variables: Order Row number dataset. PID Parcel Identifier. area Total house area square feet. price Sale price house. MS.SubClass Building class type. MS.Zoning Zoning classification property. Lot.Frontage Lot frontage length feet. Lot.Area Total lot area square feet. Street Street type access property. Alley Alley type access. Lot.Shape Shape lot. Land.Contour Land contour around property. Utilities Availability utilities. Lot.Config Lot configuration. Land.Slope Slope land. Neighborhood Neighborhood Ames. Condition.1 Proximity main conditions like railroads. Condition.2 Proximity secondary conditions. Bldg.Type Type building. House.Style Architectural style house. Overall.Qual Overall quality materials finish. Overall.Cond Overall condition house. Year.Built Year house built. Year.Remod.Add Year last remodel addition. Roof.Style Roof style. Roof.Matl Roof material. Exterior.1st Primary exterior material. Exterior.2nd Secondary exterior material. Mas.Vnr.Type Masonry veneer type. Mas.Vnr.Area Masonry veneer area square feet. Exter.Qual Exterior material quality. Exter.Cond Condition exterior material. Foundation Type foundation. Bsmt.Qual Basement quality. Bsmt.Cond Basement condition. Bsmt.Exposure Basement exposure outside. BsmtFin.Type.1 Type 1 finished basement. BsmtFin.SF.1 Square feet finished basement type 1. BsmtFin.Type.2 Type 2 finished basement. BsmtFin.SF.2 Square feet finished basement type 2. Bsmt.Unf.SF Unfinished basement area square feet. Total.Bsmt.SF Total basement area square feet. Heating Type heating system. Heating.QC Heating system quality. Central.Air Presence central air conditioning. Electrical Type electrical system. X1st.Flr.SF First floor area square feet. X2nd.Flr.SF Second floor area square feet. Low.Qual.Fin.SF Low-quality finished area square feet. Bsmt.Full.Bath Number full bathrooms basement. Bsmt.Half.Bath Number half bathrooms basement. Full.Bath Number full bathrooms ground. Half.Bath Number half bathrooms ground. Bedroom.AbvGr Number bedrooms ground. Kitchen.AbvGr Number kitchens ground. Kitchen.Qual Kitchen quality. TotRms.AbvGrd Total number rooms ground. Functional Functionality house. Fireplaces Number fireplaces. Fireplace.Qu Fireplace quality. Garage.Type Type garage. Garage.Yr.Blt Year garage built. Garage.Finish Garage finish type. Garage.Cars Number cars garage can accommodate. Garage.Area Garage area square feet. Garage.Qual Garage quality. Garage.Cond Garage condition. Paved.Drive Indicates whether driveway paved. Wood.Deck.SF Wood deck area square feet. Open.Porch.SF Open porch area square feet. Enclosed.Porch Enclosed porch area square feet. X3Ssn.Porch Three-season porch area square feet. Screen.Porch Screened porch area square feet. Pool.Area Pool area square feet. Pool.QC Pool quality. Fence Type fence. Misc.Feature Miscellaneous features property. Misc.Val Value miscellaneous features. Mo.Sold Month house sold. Yr.Sold Year house sold. Sale.Type Type sale. Sale.Condition Condition sale.

title: US Crime Rates — us_crime_rates_spec_tbl_df
text: dataset 'us_crime_rates_spec_tbl_df' contains crime statistics United States, including various types crimes population data year. dataset structured tibble ease use within R ecosystem. naming convention helps distinguish dataset part 'usdatasets' package.

title: US Crime Rates — us_crime_rates_spec_tbl_df
US Crime Rates — us_crime_rates_spec_tbl_df
text: tibble 60 rows 12 columns: year Numeric year recorded data, e.g., 2000, 2001. population Numeric population total respective year. total Numeric total number crimes reported. violent Numeric total number violent crimes. property Numeric total number property crimes. murder Numeric total number murders. forcible_rape Numeric total number forcible rapes. robbery Numeric total number robberies. aggravated_assault Numeric total number aggravated assaults. burglary Numeric total number burglaries. larceny_theft Numeric total number larcenies. vehicle_theft Numeric total number vehicle thefts.

title: US Crime Rates — us_crime_rates_spec_tbl_df
text: Federal Bureau Investigation (FBI) Uniform Crime Reporting (UCR) Program.

title: US Temperature Data — us_temp_tbl_df

title: US Temperature Data — us_temp_tbl_df
US Temperature Data — us_temp_tbl_df
text: tibble 10,118 rows 9 columns: station Character string representing weather station identifier. name Character string name weather station. latitude Numeric value latitude weather station. longitude Numeric value longitude weather station. elevation Numeric value elevation weather station meters. date Date recorded temperature data. tmax Numeric value maximum temperature recorded (degrees Celsius). tmin Numeric value minimum temperature recorded (degrees Celsius). year Factor representing year recorded data.

title: US Temperature Data — us_temp_tbl_df
text: National Oceanic Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).
